summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 among FBI personnel and possibly a detective, coordinating a 'taint review' of search terms related to the Jeffrey Epstein (JE) case. The discussion involves scheduling a meeting to get a rundown of the system and confirming availability.

persons.name: N. Young
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the initial email on July 16, 2020, providing search terms for the JE taint review and offering availability for questions.

persons.name: Det.
persons.context: Mentioned as the partner of N. Young who sits next to them and will be available to answer questions during the taint review.

connections.description: Described as partners who sit next to each other and collaborate on the JE taint review project.

events.title: Distribution of JE taint review search terms
events.description: FBI Special Agent N. Young sends an email with attached search terms for the taint review related to the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduling coordination for taint review meeting
events.description: Email exchanges attempt to coordinate a date for a meeting to get a rundown of the system for the JE taint review project.

events.title: Follow-up on taint review meeting availability
events.description: An email confirms a plan for someone to be in on Thursday morning and asks if the recipient will be around.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from August 2020 discussing a 'taint review' related to the Jeffrey Epstein (JE) case.
FBI Special Agent N. Young from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit is coordinating the review.
A detective, referred to as 'Det.', is mentioned as Young's partner and will assist in answering questions.
The emails involve scheduling a meeting to get a 'rundown of the system' for the taint review project.
The attachment 'Epstein Priv terms.docx' suggests the search terms are specifically for the Epstein case, indicating ongoing investigative work.
